dt: {bc}natives or inhabitants of Ireland or their descendants especially when of Celtic speech or culture
{bc}the Celtic language of Ireland especially as used since the later medieval period

et: Middle English, from Old English {it}*Īrisc{/it}, from {it}Īras{/it} Irishmen, of Celtic origin; akin to Old Irish {it}Ériu{/it} Ireland
shortdef: natives or inhabitants of Ireland or their descendants especially when of Celtic speech or culture
the Celtic language of Ireland especially as used since the later medieval period

dt: {bc}an incongruous statement (such as "it was hereditary in his family to have no children")

shortdef: an incongruous statement (such as "it was hereditary in his family to have no children")

dt: {bc}hot sugared coffee and Irish whiskey topped with whipped cream

shortdef: hot sugared coffee and Irish whiskey topped with whipped cream

dt: {bc}a rock or brick used as a missile

shortdef: a rock or brick used as a missile

dt: {bc}a 3- or 4-wheeled toy vehicle activated by a hand lever

shortdef: a 3- or 4-wheeled toy vehicle activated by a hand lever

dt: {bc}the dried and bleached parts of a {d_link|red alga|red alga} (especially {it}Chondrus crispus{/it}) used as an agent for thickening or emulsifying or as a demulcent and as a source of carrageenan
{bc}a red alga that is a source of Irish moss

shortdef: the dried and bleached parts of a red alga (especially Chondrus crispus) used as an agent for thickening or emulsifying or as a demulcent and as a source of carrageenan
a red alga that is a source of Irish moss —called also carrageen

dt: {bc}any of a breed of bird dogs resembling English setters but with a glossy mahogany-red coat

shortdef: any of a breed of bird dogs resembling English setters but with a glossy mahogany-red coat

dt: {bc}a stew having as its principal ingredients meat (such as lamb), potatoes, and onions in a thick gravy

shortdef: a stew having as its principal ingredients meat (such as lamb), potatoes, and onions in a thick gravy
